text: Joseph E. Irish (August 7, 1833 - May 2, 1899) was a member of the Wisconsin State Senate. Irish was born on August 7, 1833 in Paris, New York. He attended the Oneida Conference Seminary. In 1859, Irish became a preacher of the Methodist Episcopal Church. He was later chaplain to the 19th Infantry Regiment and the 8th Cavalry Regiment of the United States Army from 1892 to 1896. That year, Irish suffered a paralyzing stroke that he never fully recovered from. He died on May 2, 1899. ==Political career== Irish represented the 24th District from 1872 to 1873. He was the first clergyman to serve in the Senate. Other positions Irish held include County Surveyor of Richland County, Wisconsin, Register of the U.S. Land Office in Eau Claire, Wisconsin and U.S. Consul in Cognac, France. He was a Republican. ==References== Category:People from Paris, New York Category:People from Richland County, Wisconsin Category:Politicians from Eau Claire, Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin state senators Category:American consuls Category:American surveyors Category:Wisconsin Republicans Category:Religious leaders from Wisconsin Category:American Methodist clergy Category:19th-century Methodist ministers Category:Methodist chaplains Category:Stroke survivors Category:1833 births Category:1899 deaths Category:United States Army chaplains Category:Military personnel from Wisconsin Category:19th-century American politicians
title: Joseph E. Irish
